com.placement.subscribe

Class Subscribe

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.placement.subscribe.Subscribe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class Subscribe
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

    This class is used to register a number for alerts. I call this process as subcription To subscribe for usn's the user of this class has to generate a unique key, which is also encrypted. Now this unique key is associated with each usn is matched with the key that is received from the mobile user to authenticate the request.

    To Use the servlet: make an api call with the following parameters
    type 0: To add Mobile Numbers 1: To remove Add Numbers
    usn A list of USN's, each seperated by semicolon
    hash A list of hashkeys, each seperated by semicolon for the corresponding usn
    This method can be used generously but not too much since there is a limit on the incomming and outgoing bandwidth. Also this servlet makes a lot of datastore calls. NOTE: This method replies back in html(http-response) not in XML. henceForth urllib can be used
    Author:
    Varun V Shenoy
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addToSubscribeRequest

        private boolean addToSubscribeRequest(java.lang.String usn,
                            java.lang.String verificationHash)
        Adds a person to the datastore of valid users.
        Parameters:
        usn - the usn of the person whose subscription is to be added.
        verificationHash - the verificationHash is added to the database for future verifications for registering mobile users.
        Returns:
        whether the operation was successful or not.

      • removeSubscribeRequest

        private boolean removeSubscribeRequest(java.lang.String usn,
                             java.lang.String verificationHash)
        Adds a person to the datastore of valid users.
        Parameters:
        usn - the usn of the person whose subscription is to be removed.
        verificationHash - the verificationHash authenticates the whole removal transaction.
        Returns:
        whether the operation was successful or not.

      • sendResponse

        private void sendResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpResponse,
                java.lang.String response)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used whenever one wants to say something to the user, ie the person who has made the API call. It is strongly advised that you call this method no more than once in the entire servlet.(Not a requirement)
        Parameters:
        httpResponse - the response object sent by the servlet container
        response - the response text to be sent to the user, ie the person who has sent a text message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
